title: Jimmy Edgar's "Bounce Make Model" minimalist caps - Lineto like?
content: A sweet minimalist display font, does anyone know what it is? ![minimalist display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415050148im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69899.jpg)
author: designalchemy

comments.content:
A custom type by Universal Everthing?   
   
 [http://www.universaleverything.com/recent\_activity/114](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415050148/http:/www.universaleverything.com/recent_activity/114)
I think Universal Everything made the packaging, but it looks like The Design Republic (TDR) actually did the design. I think it is a custom typeface. Warp records is one of the TDR clients.

If you are just trying to find a similar look, House's Neutraface Display Thin is similar, as you might see in this re-creation of the album wording:   
 ![Jimmy Edgar Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415050148im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69930.gif)

You could also check out [Burin Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415050148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/burin-sans/burin-sans/testdrive.html?s=BOUNCE+MAKE+MODEL&p=48). Letters have different shapes but it's nice and thin. The M in your sample looks like a W flipped upside down.

Nice find, Fabio..   
   
_Mike, Matt Pyke ( Universal Everything ) also was a former member of tDR, so he may have created both.. ( Slightly seems like 'Ex~tDR' week, here on Typophile.. )_
I think we've had these before, but can't find the relevant thread.
